title: 'Differences must not become disputes': Jaishankar tells Chinese counterpart – Key discussions
content: Foreign Minister Wang Yi's visit to New Delhi marks a renewed effort to improve Sino-Indian relations. Wang's meeting with S Jaishankar and participation in border talks with Ajit Doval, follows agreements made between Modi and Xi in Kazan. China aims to build political trust, expand cooperation, and manage differences for stable bilateral ties.

title: PM Modi meets Shubhanshu Shukla; astronaut shows Earth photos clicked from ISS
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, celebrating his Axiom-4 mission to the ISS and India's growing space capabilities. Shukla shared pictures from space and received accolades in Parliament, though the Opposition's boycott drew criticism. India's space ambitions, including the Gaganyaan program and a planned space station, were highlighted, with the first module expected by 2028.

title: Putin-Modi talks: Russian president dials PM; shares insights on Alaska meet with Trump
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a call from Russian President Vladimir Putin, who shared insights from his recent Alaska meeting with US President Donald Trump regarding a proposed peace deal. PM Modi reaffirmed India's consistent advocacy for a peaceful resolution to the Ukraine conflict and expressed support for all efforts aimed at achieving that goal.

title: Asia Cup: What’s India’s head-to-head record against Pakistan?
content: The 2025 Asia Cup, set in the UAE from September 9-28, will be in the T20 format, highlighted by the India vs Pakistan clash on September 14 in Dubai. This tournament serves as crucial preparation for the T20 World Cup 2026.

title: Mass layoffs: CEO laid off 80% employees two years ago; now says that he….
content: IgniteTech CEO Eric Vaughan replaced nearly 80% of his workforce in 2023 due to resistance to the company's AI adoption mandate. Despite employee sabotage and refusal to participate, the transformation led to substantial returns, including the launch of two AI solutions and high profit margins. Vaughan doesn't recommend this strategy, citing cultural resistance as the cause.

title: 'When confronted & destroyed!' Trump links Hamas' fate to hostage return
content: Donald Trump asserted that the release of hostages held by Hamas hinges on the group's confrontation and destruction. He emphasized his past achievements in securing hostage releases and resolving conflicts, highlighting his role in freeing hundreds of hostages and ending multiple wars. Trump urged decisive action, advocating for a strategy focused on victory.

title: Top 2 T20I run-scorers for both India and Pakistan won't be part of Asia Cup 2025 - here is why
content: The 2025 T20 Asia Cup will see India and Pakistan without key players. Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have retired. Pakistan dropped Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan. Salman Ali Agha will lead Pakistan in a preparatory series. Pakistan faces India, UAE, and Oman in Group A. India's squad is still awaited. The Asia Cup concludes on September 28.

title: Moody's chief economist, who thinks the US is on the verge of recession, has...
content: Amidst rising recession fears, Moody's Analytics chief economist Mark Zandi offers a glimmer of hope for tech professionals. Despite troubling economic indicators like flatlined consumer spending and contracting manufacturing, Zandi highlights the tech sector's resilience. Factors such as persistent AI demand, cloud infrastructure investment, global hiring flexibility, and digital transformation spending are expected to insulate the industry.

title: YSRCP backs CP Radhakrishnan: Jagan's party supports NDA nominee
content: The YSR Congress Party, with its 11 MPs, has pledged its support to NDA's vice-presidential candidate, C P Radhakrishnan, bolstering the ruling alliance's prospects. YSRCP MP Maddila Gurumoorthy confirmed the party's backing, even as the opposition gears up to nominate its own candidate. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh reportedly contacted YSR Congress chief Jagan Mohan Reddy to secure the endorsement.

title: Microsoft's new return to office plan: Company requires 3-day office attendance
content: Microsoft will require employees near its Redmond headquarters to work in the office at least three days a week starting in January 2025, potentially leading to resignations. This shift reverses previous flexibility and aligns Microsoft with other tech giants mandating in-office attendance. Employees view the policy as a possible "stealth layoff" amid concerns about office space and resources, despite the company's strong financial performance.

title: Exports to US likely saw 7x faster growth vs overall rise
content: Indian exports to the US surged by 21% due to frontloading in anticipation of Trump's tariffs, overshadowing overall export growth. While exporters are offering discounts to retain business amidst uncertainty, concerns remain about sustaining operations if tariffs reach 50%. Industry leaders are seeking government support to mitigate potential job losses, particularly in the MSME sector.

title: 'Don’t make Vaibhav Suryavanshi wait': Team India's Asia Cup squad selection debate receives fresh twist
content: Kris Srikkanth, former India captain, has surprisingly advocated for 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi's inclusion in the Asia Cup T20 squad. Suryavanshi's impressive IPL 2025 performance and U19 tour of England have made him a strong contender. Srikkanth emphasizes Suryavanshi's maturity and shot-making ability, urging selectors to consider him for the upcoming T20 World Cup.

title: 'EC must first affirm voter list is clean, then we'll comply': INDIA bloc steps up attack
content: The INDIA bloc has criticised the Election Commission. Opposition leaders allege misconduct in recent elections. They question the special revision of electoral rolls in Bihar. Concerns were raised about voter list irregularities in Maharashtra and Karnataka. Trinamool Congress leader Mahua Moitra called for dissolving the Lok Sabha. The opposition demands accountability from the Election Commission.

title: Sophie Cunningham injury update: How the Indiana fever guard got injured
content: Sophie Cunningham sustained a right knee injury during a game against Connecticut Sun. The incident occurred in the second quarter. Cunningham's injury adds to the Fever's existing injury woes. An MRI is scheduled to determine the extent of the damage. Fans and teammates express their support. The team is awaiting the MRI results.

title: NASA locks volunteers in Mars simulation: PS4 keeps them sane
content: In a groundbreaking experiment, NASA's CHAPEA mission simulated Martian life for over a year, confining four volunteers to a habitat. Beyond survival and adaptation, the crew discovered an unexpected benefit in PS4 gaming. Video games helped maintain cognitive sharpness, reduce stress, and improve problem-solving skills.

title: MP shocker: Class 2 student found dead under mysterious circumstances in hostel; probe under way
content: A Class 2 student, Anurag (7), was discovered dead in the Gyan Ganga School hostel in Khajuraho, Madhya Pradesh. His roommate found him unresponsive, and authorities were alerted. While no external injuries were visible, blue marks were noted on his body, prompting police to investigate potential poisoning or insect bites.

title: B-schools see non-engineers rise: Engineering dominance cracks; What’s behind the management reset?
content: India’s elite B-schools are witnessing a paradigm shift: engineers no longer dominate MBA classrooms. Non-engineers—economists, commerce graduates, and humanities students—are now matching or surpassing their peers in institutes like IIM Ahmedabad, Lucknow, and Indore. Changing corporate demands, revamped admission policies, and rising aspirations among non-engineers are driving this transformation, signaling the end of engineering monopoly in management education.

title: Bumrah offered fresh advice on workload: 'Our physios are the better judges'
content: Former BCCI chairman Chetan Sharma has defended Jasprit Bumrah's decision to play only three Tests against England, citing workload management based on medical advice. Sharma expressed confidence in India's chances at the upcoming Asia Cup, emphasising the team's strong performance and the advantage of hosting the T20 World Cup in 2026.

title: 'Seriously controversial': Trump questions accuracy of voting machines; vows to end mail-in ballots
content: Donald Trump announced a movement to eliminate mail-in ballots and voting machines before the 2026 midterms, citing "massive voter fraud." He plans an executive order targeting voting machines and advocates for watermarked paper ballots, claiming they're faster and more reliable.

title: How Gavin Newsom is out-trumping Trump
content: That viral split screen of scarf vs fatigues was meant to define who had grit and who had privilege. But in modern politics, biography matters less than performance. Vance leveraged his Marine past to ride Trump’s coattails into the vice presidency. Newsom is leveraging parody to carve out space as the Democrat unafraid of MAGA. Act one was the split screen. Act two is the troll war. Act three, if it comes, will be 2028 — where Gavin Newsom will either be remembered as the liberal who cosplayed Trump for a season or the Democrat who figured out how to use memes to win power. Could he be the Lyndon Johnson of the meme era — underestimated, even mocked, until history forced him into greatness? That remains unanswered. But for now, MAGA finally knows what it feels like to be on the receiving end of ridicule. And Gavin Newsom is laughing loudest.

title: Arjun Tendulkar engaged to Saaniya Chandok: How has Sachin's son performed on the field?
content: Arjun Tendulkar, son of cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar, recently got engaged to Saaniya Chandok, who hails from a prominent Mumbai business family. The private, family-oriented ceremony marks a joyous occasion for both families.

title: Airtel down: Thousands of users unable to make calls, access internet data
content: Airtel is currently grappling with a significant service outage, impacting thousands of subscribers who are reporting disruptions in both voice and data services since approximately 3:30 PM. Users are expressing their frustration on X, highlighting issues with making calls, sending messages, and accessing mobile internet.

title: Mumbai rains: Heavy showers flood roads tracks, bring city to standstill - video
content: Mumbai was hit by torrential rainfall, leading to severe waterlogging and traffic disruptions across the city. Several areas recorded over 100 mm of rain in just six hours, paralyzing transportation and prompting school closures.

title: 'India like shining Mercedes': Pak interior min echoes Munir's crude analogy
content: Pakistan's Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi has escalated tensions with India by repeating a controversial analogy made by Army Chief Asim Munir, comparing India to a “shining Mercedes” and Pakistan to a “dump truck.” This statement, initially made during a Saudi delegation visit aimed at de-escalating border tensions, has drawn criticism.

title: 'You’re Tharoor in saree': Priyanka shares humorous moment - see how Shashi responded
content: Priyanka Chaturvedi's podcast banter with Smika Prakash, referencing Shashi Tharoor, sparked a witty exchange online. Chaturvedi, part of a delegation highlighting India's anti-terrorism stance post-Operation Sindoor, emphasized representing the nation abroad despite being a vocal opposition member domestically. She also criticized the Election Commission of India, expressing concerns about eroding public trust and perceived bias towards the BJP.

title: Exclusive | 'Don't underestimate Shubman Gill' - Harbhajan Singh
content: With the Asia Cup 2025 squad set to be announced, Harbhajan Singh has backed Shubman Gill for inclusion despite stiff competition from India’s power-hitters. Bhajji insisted Gill’s solid basics and adaptability make him a potential T20 dominator. Calling this a “new era” without Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, Harbhajan praised the youngsters for carrying forward Indian cricket’s legacy.

title: 9-year-old girl dies due to 'brain-eating amoeba' in Kerala
content: A nine-year-old girl from Thamarassery, Kerala, succumbed to a brain infection. The infection was due to Naegleria fowleri. Health officials confirmed the death. This is the fourth reported case in the district this year. Authorities are investigating the source of the infection. Experts advise caution when swimming in freshwater. They also recommend using sterile water for nasal cleaning.

title: Watch: Bhuni toll plaza vandalised following assault on army jawan
content: An Army jawan, Kapil Kavad, was assaulted at Bhuni Toll Plaza in Meerut, triggering a violent reaction from villagers. They stormed the toll, vandalizing property and confronting staff. Police have arrested four individuals and deployed a heavy force to the area, while CCTV footage is being reviewed as part of the ongoing investigation.

title: ‘Another war may happen’: Khamenei’s aide warns US, Israel
content: A top advisor to Iran's Supreme Leader warned that renewed conflict with the U.S. or Israel could erupt anytime, escalating regional tensions. Yahya Rahim Safavi emphasized Iran's need to bolster its defenses across all sectors. This warning follows reported Israeli strikes on Iranian command centers and U.S.

title: Harjinder Singh faces deportation: Trucker took reckless U-turn in Florida that killed 3
content: A tragic accident on the Florida Turnpike resulted in three fatalities after a minivan collided with a tractor-trailer executing an illegal U-turn. Harjinder Singh, the truck driver and an undocumented immigrant, faces vehicular homicide charges for allegedly causing the devastating crash near Fort Pierce. The collision occurred when Singh's trailer blocked all lanes, leaving the minivan with no chance to avoid impact.

title: Mumbai rain mayhem: 9 flights abort landing; city waterlogged, trains affected
content: Mumbai experienced significant disruptions due to heavy rainfall, impacting air and road travel. Several flights faced landing difficulties, with some forced to go around or divert. Commuters faced waterlogged roads and slow-moving traffic, prompting travel advisories from airlines.

title: Trump-Zelenskyy meet: Will Ukrainian prez finally suit up after WH wardrobe drama?
content: Volodymyr Zelenskyy is expected to adopt a more formal appearance during his upcoming meeting with US President Donald Trump in Washington, according to a designer who has previously collaborated with him. This shift comes after criticism of his informal attire during a previous visit to the White House.

title: Watch: Children stuck in school bus on flooded Mumbai road; rescued
content: In Mumbai, a school bus with six children and two staff members became stranded in a waterlogged street due to heavy rains. Promptly responding to the emergency, police officers arrived at the scene and successfully rescued all the passengers. Following the rescue, the children were safely transported to the Matunga Police Station.

title: Ranthambore guide abandons vehicle mid-jungle in dark; 3 vehicles, drivers banned
content: Following a concerning incident where tourists were left stranded in Ranthambore forest due to a vehicle breakdown and subsequent failures in assistance, authorities have banned three safari vehicles, their drivers, and a guide.

title: 'War 2' box office live: Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR starrer starts slow
content: Released on August 14th amidst a clash with 'Coolie', 'War 2' initially lagged behind, earning ₹51.5 crore on its first day. However, boosted by Independence Day, day 2 collections surged to ₹56.50 crore, crossing ₹100 crore in all languages. While the Hindi version rebounded strongly, the Telugu version saw a significant drop over the weekend, with total collections reaching ₹175.

title: Netaji 'fled fearing British'? Kerala's SCERT corrects textbook error
content: Kerala's SCERT corrected a historic error in a Class 4 teachers' handbook that wrongly stated Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose 'fled fearing the British' before forming the INA. The mistake was flagged by teachers and quickly removed, prompting an internal inquiry. The controversy sparked criticism from the ABVP, accusing the Kerala government of distorting history and undermining national unity. Complaints have been filed demanding strict action and better oversight of educational materials.

title: Delhi horror: Man rapes mother twice
content: In a shocking incident in Delhi's Hauz Qazi, a 39-year-old man has been arrested following allegations of raping his 66-year-old mother. The victim, along with her daughter, reported the crime to the police, stating the assaults occurred after their return from a pilgrimage.

title: Princess Anne's 75th Birthday: William and Kate share a simple message with a new portrait
content: Princess Anne celebrated her 75th birthday, marked by a newly released portrait and a simple birthday wish from the Prince and Princess of Wales. The imagery and messages emphasized her dedication to service and her understated style.

title: ‘Racist’: Swatch ad outrages China; watchmaker apologises over ‘slant-eye’ gesture
content: Swatch, a Swiss watchmaker, faced criticism in China. An advertisement was deemed racist. It showed an Asian model pulling his eyes. This gesture offended many Chinese social media users. They called for a boycott. Swatch apologised and removed the ad globally. However, many felt the apology was insufficient.

title: Asia Cup 2025: SKY to stay as India’s T20I captain, Gill likely to miss out
content: India are set to back Suryakumar Yadav as T20I captain for Asia Cup 2025, with Shubman Gill and Shreyas Iyer likely to miss out despite stellar form. Samson, Abhishek Sharma, and Tilak Varma remain first-choice batters, while Jasprit Bumrah returns to lead the attack. Mohammed Siraj is expected to be rested, with Prasidh Krishna and Washington Sundar among likely inclusions.

title: Woman’s father runs over couple on bike; man killed, daughter injured
content: In Madurai, a man was killed after being run over by his girlfriend's father, who disapproved of their relationship. The couple, who had previously eloped, were targeted after leaving a police station following a dispute over alleged stolen jewelry. The woman is hospitalized, and her father has been arrested for planning the murder.

title: All You Need To Know About Zelensky's Upcoming Meeting With Trump In US
content: US President Donald Trump is set to host Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and European leaders at the White House on Monday to discuss how to end Russia's three-year war in Ukraine.

title: Mumbai Rain Updates: Schools To Be Shut On Tuesday, Red Alert Issued
content: Mumbai Rain Live Updates: Several parts of Mumbai received more than 100 mm rainfall in nine hours on Monday, with Vikhroli in the eastern suburbs topping the chart

title: "Important That De-escalation On Border Continues": S Jaishankar, Wang Yi Meet
content: Foreign minister S Jaishankar -- at his meeting with his Chinese counterpart Wang Yi today -- made the point that India and China would move forward with their bilateral relationship after "having seen a difficult period in our relationship".

title: "Freedom We Must Now Fight For Is The Freedom Of Self-Reliance": Gautam Adani
content: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani on Monday urged the country to strengthen its technological and economic independence as its future security will depend on more than just protecting its borders.

title: "Students Are Next Generation Of Freedom Fighters": Gautam Adani At IIT Kharagpur
content: The world is moving from conventional wars to technology-driven wars of power, and our ability to prepare will decide our future, Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani said on Monday.

title: "Weapons Today Are Algorithms, Not Guns": Gautam Adani At IIT Kharagpur
content: The wars nowadays are often invisible and technology-driven, industrialist Gautam Adani said at IIT Kharagpur on Monday evening, asserting that algorithms are today's weapons and not guns.

title: Rain Havoc In Mumbai: A Look At 10 Most Striking Visuals
content: Mumbai continued to receive heavy rains for the third consecutive day on Monday, leading to waterlogging and heavy traffic jams in many parts of the city.

title: "Illegal Immigrant": Team Trump After Indian-Origin Man's Wrong U-Turn Kills 3 In US
content: Three people were killed on Florida's Turnpike on Saturday after a semi-truck made an illegal U-turn, causing a collision. The tragic incident also set off a tornado of racist taunts thrown at the Indian-origin driver.

title: Vijay Rallies Cadre Ahead Of Madurai Meet, Predicts TVK Win In 2026 Polls
content: TVK Chief and actor Vijay issued a rallying call to cadre ahead of the party's state conference in Madurai on August 21, declaring that the 2026 Assembly polls will mark a turning point in Tamil Nadu's political history.

title: 'Salary Or Legacy?' Gautam Adani To Graduating Students At IIT Kharagpur
content: Gautam Adani, Chairman of the Adani Group, turned philosopher, historian, and futurist at IIT Kharagpur on Monday as he urged India's brightest engineering students to choose a life of "legacy over salary".

title: Spain Wildfires Burn Area Equivalent To Half Million Soccer Fields: Report
content: Deadly wildfires ravaging Spain have burnt the equivalent of nearly half a million football fields this year, setting a new record for the country, a European monitor said Monday.

title: "Disappointing": Rajnath Singh As Opposition Skips Shubhanshu Shukla Discussion
content: "Extremely Disappointing Behaviour": Rajnath Singh After Opposition Skips Shubhanshu Shukla Discussion

title: House Caves In, Several Other Structures Damaged In Dhanbad Land Sinking
content: A house caved in and a dozen others developed cracks after a land subsidence incident in a Bharat Coking Coal Ltd (BCCL) area, about 19 km from Dhanbad district headquarters on Monday, a company official said.

title: "I'm A Powerful Leader": Himanta Sarma On Gaurav Gogoi's 'Secret Phone' Claim
content: Assam Congress chief Gaurav Gogoi alleged that the state's Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has a 'secret phone' to contact the former's party in times of crisis.

title: All About The Crimean Peninsula Russia Seized From Ukraine Over A Decade Ago
content: Russia's illegal seizure of the Crimean Peninsula from Ukraine in March 2014 was quick and bloodless, and it sent Moscow's relations with the West into a downward spiral unseen since the Cold War.

title: India Bloc Meet Underway To Discuss Opposition's Joint Vice President Candidate
content: The INDIA bloc is holding a meet to finalise the Opposition candidate for the Vice President post -- the election is on September 9.

title: Airtel Services Temporarily Down In Delhi-NCR, Company Apologises
content: Airtel users in Delhi and neighbouring areas are facing an outage, with many complaining of not being able to make calls, send messages and access the internet. Some have also said that they are not getting a signal at all.

title: Hurricane Erin To Bring Dangerous Surf, Rip Currents To US Coast
content: A stronger and bigger Hurricane Erin pelted parts of the Caribbean and was forecast to create dangerous surf and rip currents along the U.S. East Coast this week.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Bomb And The Button: Time To Call Pakistan's Nuclear Blackmail By Its Name
content: For decades, Pakistan's military has wielded its nuclear arsenal not as a deterrent, but as a diplomatic cudgel - a tool to intimidate India, extract concessions, and shield itself from accountability.

title: 93 couples tie the knot during free mass marriage ceremony at M.M. Hills
content: Since 1989, 2,024 couples have been married through such mass weddings at the shrine, says MLA for Hanur

title: Karnataka Home Minister instructs police to take action against Mahesh Shetty Thimarodi
content: Home Minister G. Parameshwara on Monday informed the Legislative Assembly that he has instructed the police to take stern action against activist Mahesh Shetty Thimarodi who has alleged that Chief Minister Siddaramaiah had ‘murdered 24 people’

title: Heavy rains continue in many parts of Malnad region: Houses collapse, inflow to reservoirs increase, schools remain closed in rain-hit areas
content: ‘A portion of an old pond, which is a part of the historic Bidanur fort at Nagara in Hosanagara taluk of Shivamogga district, collapsed due to heavy rains on Sunday night’

title: Kerala HC seeks instructions from government on graft charges against former Kannur district panchayat chief P.P. Divya
content: KSU leader alleges bid to sabotage probe against Ms. Divya in connection with alleged “corruption and benami property transactions to the tune of crores of rupees”

title: CPI(M) threatens to blockade NHAI officials’ houses over NH 544 gridlock
content: Accusing authorities of negligence that leave commuters stranded for hours, party says the issue should be resolved by August 21. Two days ago there was an 18-hour-long traffic jam on the Ernakulam-Thrissur stretch

title: Attack on Election Commission of India by Rahul, Opposition reflects frustration at losing polls: BJP
content: “How to win elections through intruders, how to use intruders, how to carry forward appeasement politics — this is what the Congress and Rahul Gandhi have been doing,” says Sambit Patra

title: Supreme Court defers hearing Punjab government’s plea over delay in clearing bills
content: The Chief Justice said the petition would be taken up only after a Constitution Bench answers a Presidential Reference on whether the court can set timelines for Governors and the President to act on State Bills

title: At IDSFFK, package of films from Annecy International Animation Film Festival to be screened
content: The 17th International Documentary and Short Film Festival of Kerala (IDSFFK) will held from August 22 to 27 in Thiruvananthapuram.

title: BJP president Nadda hails Modi, slams Nehru over Indus Waters Treaty
content: Nadda says Prime Minister Modi puts the Indus Water Treaty in abeyance, correcting Nehru’s ‘Himalayan blunder’

title: UPSC-Kerala PSC exams’ date clash sparks concern among aspirants
content: The SI Mains exam is scheduled for August 30, which coincides with one of the dates of the UPSC Mains exam.

title: Officials appeal to people of Mandya dist. to celebrate Ganesha festival, Id Milad in peaceful manner
content: The organisers should apply for permission at the single window counters set up in taluk offices, mentioning the date of installation, duration, date and place of immersion, and the route map for processions

title: Health dept. prepares action plan ahead of Sabarimala season
content: The Konni medical college hospital will function as the base hospital, where more facilities will be created, says Health Minister. Extra beds will be arranged in hospitals in Pathanamthitta, Alappuzha, Kottayam and Idukki districts

title: Milma Thiruvananthapuram regional union’s bottled milk to be launched on August 19
content: ‘Milma Cow Milk,’ priced at ₹70, will initially be available at sales outlets of Milma and its agencies in Thiruvananthapuram district in one litre bottles. It will be marketed in Kollam, Pathanamthitta and Alappuzha in subsequent stages.

title: A.P. Minister tells KGBV students to focus on academics
content: Janardhan Reddy inspects works at KGBV in Banaganapalle, where the government is constructing six additional rooms at a cost of ₹2.5 crore

title: SCERT told to debar textbook development team over errors
content: Corrections available on SCERT website; teachers’ handbook to be printed only after including historical facts, says Minister

title: Madigas demand immediate implementation of internal quota within Scheduled Castes
content: Members of the Dalit Left category stage a protest in favour of the Nagamohan Das Commission recommendations

title: Visva-Bharati refuses to allow lecture on Amartya Sen in its library
content: Following the university’s refusal to grant permission, the event was held at a private auditorium; the university said the lecture clashed with its Rabindra Saptaha lecture

title: 11 more families from Koottickal hit by 2021 floods to be given houses
content: Along with the key handover ceremony on August 21, the foundation stone for 10 more houses across Poonjar constituency will be laid

title: Suresh Gopi’s LS victory a product of organised vote theft, says Prathapan
content: Congress leader gives statement to Thrissur ACP on his complaint that Suresh Gopi and his family had enrolled themselves as voters in Thrissur just before the last Lok Sabha elections using fraudulent documents

title: Belagavi milk union decides to redistribute profit of ₹10 crore among farmers
content: We have made a modest profit of ₹13 crore last year, says MLA and union president Balachandra Jarkiholi

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Supreme Court appoints Justice Dhulia as Chairperson of search panel for V-Cs of two Kerala varsities
content: Supreme Court stresses the need to end the impasse between the Governor and the State over V-C appointments ‘at the earliest’

title: Cybercrime in Karnataka drops on paper, evolves in reality
content: As public awareness grew, fraudsters devised more advanced methods, such as courier scams and investment scams. These caused victims to lose large amounts, say the police.

title: As Syro-Malabar Church Synod commences, CMI launches stinging attack on bishops over liturgical dispute
content: The clerical congregation criticises the  bishops for the abrupt suspension of the special tribunal established in the Ernakulam-Angamaly Archdiocese without any show-cause notice or warnings.

title: Five-day science exhibition begins at Agriculture college in Shivamogga
content: ISRO, DRDO, Institute of Plasma Research, VITM, and other institutes are participating in the exhibition that will conclude on August 22

title: Govt. school enrolment in Karnataka has declined by 10.38% in three years
content: Enrolment to government primary schools and high schools across the State has shown a steady decline since the 2022-2023 academic year, according to data placed by the Department of School Education and Literacy before the Legislative Council on Monday. The enrolment has shown a decline by 10.38% in three years

title: West Bengal academics object to certain members of panel selecting V-Cs for 15 State universities
content: The selection panel, chaired by retired CJI U.U. Lalit, includes Ramesh Chandra, former V-C of Maharaja Surajmal Brij University, Bharatpur, Rajasthan, who is facing graft charges; and a retired IAS officer working for the Raj Bhavan

title: Discharge of water from KRS: HDK instructs Mandya DC to fill up lakes in district
content: Kumaraswamy, who also represents Mandya in the Lok Sabha, called up the Deputy Commissioner over phone from New Delhi after seeing media reports on the authorities stepping up the outflow of water from KRS on Monday

title: My plan is to revive AIADMK, says V.K. Sasikala
content: Supporting the sanitation workers, she alleges that the DMK has not fulfilled its promise of regularising their jobs

title: Kerala HC permits woman doctor to implead in sexual assault case against Vedan
content: Complainant has alleged that the rapper had sexually assaulted her multiple times on the promise of marriage. Vedan terms the relationship consensual

title: Art reflects the values of law and justice, says judge
content: Exhibition of paintings and photographs organized by the Zilla Kannada Sahitya Parishat inaugurated in Kalaburagi

title: Two Maoists arrested in Jharkhand's Latehar
content: Jharkhand police arrest two JJMP members in Latehar district after raiding their homes based on a tip-off

title: Cow goes missing after highway accident; sparks concern over lack of animal rescue helpline
content: Minister T.R.B. Raaja responds to a social media posting and alerts Thanjavur district administration; by the time confusion over jurisdiction was cleared and rescue time reached the spot, it was too late

title: Bengaluru police book former UP MLA for sexual assault on woman in city hotel
content: The victim had allegedly been in a live-in relationship with 51-year-old Bhagwan Sharma, a former MLA from the Debai Assembly constituency in UP’s Bulandshahr district since 2017, and the couple has a seven-year-old son.

title: Karnataka losing over ₹20,000 crore annually after migration to GST regime
content: Karnataka has been losing ₹20,000 crore to ₹25,000 crore annually owing to migration to the Goods and Services Tax regime in 2017, while the State’s contribution to the GST pool has been increasing

title: SPDCL says there’s no negligence of utility for electrocution
content: The local officials of the power utility informed the CMD that an unused television cable snapped and had fallen on the 11kV overhead line and then onto the chariot with the metal/iron frame allowing transmission of power and led to electrocution

title: Don’t panic over heart attacks as numbers show no alarming rise: Karnataka Minister
content: Though concerns have been raised over heart attacks related to lifestyle, there has been no significant increase in numbers, says Sharan Prakash Patil

title: Delhi HC reserves order on jailed MP Engineer Rashid's plea over security expenses
content: The court observed if Mr. Rashid was not released on interim bail and attended Parliament in custody, why should he, and not the jail authorities, bear the costs

title: Chief Minister to inaugurate work on Kalladi-Meppadi  tunnel road project in Kozhikode on August 31
content: ₹2,134-crore project will be completed in association with Public Works department, Kerala Infrastructure Investment Fund Board and Konkan Railway Corporation

title: CEC did not answer our questions, acting like a BJP spokesperson: Opposition
content: Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Mahua Moitra said that if the voter list, on which the last general election was conducted, is not correct, the Lok Sabha should be dissolved

title: Parliament passes Bill to consolidate law relating to ports, facilitate ease of doing business
content: The Indian Ports Bill 2025, which was passed by the Lok Sabha on August 12, was introduced in the Upper House on Monday amid noisy protests by the Opposition

title: Kerala government committed to sustainable development of State’s coastal areas: Minister Rajeeve
content: Inaugurating a two-day workshop on ‘Resilient coasts, thriving communities: A sea of solutions,’ the Minister says projects, including construction of tetrapod seawall, are being carried out to resist sea incursion and other issues caused by climate change

title: Jagan Mohan Reddy expresses shock over electrocution tragedy in Hyderabad
content: Jagan Mohan Reddy wished for the speedy recovery of the injured and urged officials to take stringent safety measures to ensure such accidents do not recur in the future

title: Heavy rain likely to continue in coastal districts on August 19 and 20 as depression is likely to form over the Bay
content: The well-marked low-pressure area over west central and northwest Bay of Bengal, off north Andhra Pradesh-south Odisha coasts, persisted over the same region at 8.30 a.m. on August 18, 2025

title: Illegal tree felling threatens Vaniyanthal lake nesting site in Kallakurichi
content: The tree felling has been continuing over the past few days and nearly 30% of the total 900 trees in and around the lake have been cut, according to environmentalists.

title: Supreme Court asks if NHAI ought to compensate commuters for fuel, patience in 12-hour traffic snarl in Kerala
content: It wasn’t an ‘act of God’; the overturned truck that caused the snarl fell into a pothole as ‘the road is in such a state of disrepair,’ the court remarked, referring to media reports

title: Trump to Zelenskyy: Drop Nato hopes, Crimea before peace talks

title: Barnwell picks five NFL teams set to improve: Who could go from worst to first?
content: Which teams will bounce back and win more games this season? We made five picks based on offseason additions, fumble luck and more.

title: Omaha forward Mayar dies in drowning incident
content: Omaha Mavericks forward Deng Mayar, who transferred from North Dakota this offseason, died Saturday in a drowning incident.

title: Source: Bond gets $3M guarantee from Browns
content: The Cleveland Browns are signing ex-Longhorns WR Isaiah Bond to a 3-year, $3.018 million deal days after a grand jury declined to indict him on a sexual assault charge, a source told ESPN.

title: Bills called out by McDermott after blowout loss
content: Bills coach Sean McDermott said his team's blowout preseason loss to the Bears was "certainly not up to our standard."

title: Sources: Ex-Irish QB Angeli named Cuse starter
content: Syracuse has named Notre Dame transfer Steve Angeli the starting quarterback, sources told ESPN, and he'll debut for the Orange against No. 24 Tennessee in the opener in Atlanta.

title: Robles ejected for hurling bat at Triple-A pitcher
content: During his rehabilitation assignment with Triple-A Tacoma on Sunday, Mariners veteran outfielder Victor Robles was ejected from a game in Las Vegas, after he was nearly hit by an inside pitch and tossed his bat at starting pitcher Joey Estes.

title: Sources: DFA'd by Nats, Lowe set to join Red Sox
content: Veteran first baseman Nathaniel Lowe, 30, designated for assignment by the Washington Nationals earlier this month, and the Boston Red Sox are finalizing a deal, sources told ESPN, paving the way for him to join one of the strongest lineups in baseball.

title: Vols name Aguilar starting QB after Iamaleava exit
content: Joey Aguilar was named Tennessee's starting quarterback Sunday, beating out redshirt freshman Jake Merklinger for the job.

title: Scheffler wins BMW, fifth PGA Tour crown of '25
content: Scottie Scheffler erased a four-shot deficit in five holes then delivered a haymaker on the daunting par-3 17th by chipping in from 82 feet for birdie that carried him to victory Sunday in the BMW Championship for his fifth PGA Tour title of the year.

title: 🏈 Fantasy Football 2025: Ultimate Draft Board
